word: Effort and labor are required on the part of the receiver of God's grace; for it is the fruit that makes manifest what is the character of the tree. Although the good works of man are of no more value without faith in Jesus than was the offering of Cain, yet covered with the merit of Christ, they testify [to] the worthiness of the doer to inherit eternal life. That which is considered morality in the world does not reach the divine standard and has no more merit before Heaven than had the offering of Cain. [SELECTED MESSAGES, BOOK 1, PP. 379-382. FOR A LETTER TO A PREACHER WARNING AGAINST A ONE-SIDED PRESENTATION SEE PAGES 377-379.]
